A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I think you need to go into the movie with an open mind and remember that this is a new trilogy\, not the originals. I don’t understand the hate that some are giving this movie. I absolutely loved it (it’s not my all time favorite\, but I still really really enjoyed it). I liked the pacing of the plot going between the three main stories. I don’t want to spoil anything for those who haven’t seen it\, so here’s a couple of spoiler-free things I will say: 1. There’s a bunch of easter eggs and callbacks to the original trilogy (as you would expect lol) 2. There’s a few new faces in this movie\, some of which play an important roll in helping the main trio. 3. There are several plot twists that I didn’t expect (I was practically gaping at one point) 4. There’s a lovely send-off for a character (it’s probably not who you’re thinking though). 5. FINALLY: the fight between being considered a part of the “light” or “dark” side is getting more complicated. I’m really hoping they’re sending Rey on the grey Jedi path (that’s just my own hope though). Anyway\, ignore the hatred that some people are spewing and forge your own opinion on the movie. Give it a shot— it’ll be what you expect and more! Regardless\, there’s still another movie to look forward to for anyone who’s bummed out.
